 227          """ 
 228          Sends an email using data specified in constructor 
 229   
 230          Arguments:: 
 231   
 232              to: list or tuple of receiver addresses; will also accept single 
 233                  object 
 234              subject: subject of the email 
 235              message: email body text; depends on type of passed object: 
 236                       if 2-list or 2-tuple is passed: first element will be 
 237                       source of plain text while second of html text; 
 238                       otherwise: object will be the only source of plain text 
 239                       and html source will be set to None; 
 240                       If text or html source is: 
 241                       None: content part will be ignored, 
 242                       string: content part will be set to it, 
 243                       file-like object: content part will be fetched from 
 244                                         it using it's read() method 
 245              attachments: list or tuple of Mail.Attachment objects; will also 
 246                           accept single object 
 247              cc: list or tuple of carbon copy receiver addresses; will also 
 248                  accept single object 
 249              bcc: list or tuple of blind carbon copy receiver addresses; will 
 250                  also accept single object 
 251              reply_to: address to which reply should be composed 
 252              encoding: encoding of all strings passed to this method (including 
 253                        message bodies) 
 254   
 255          Examples:: 
 256   
 257              #Send plain text message to single address: 
 258              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 259                        'Message subject', 
 260                        'Plain text body of the message') 
 261   
 262              #Send text and html message to three addresses (two in cc): 
 263              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 264                        'Message subject', 
 265                        ('Plain text body', <html>html body</html>), 
 266                        cc=['other1@example.com', 'other2@example.com'])

 268              #Send html only message with image attachment available from

 291          def encode_header(key): 
 292              if [c for c in key if 32>ord(c) or ord(c)>127]: 
 293                  return Header.Header(key.encode('utf-8'),'utf-8') 
 294              else:

 354          if cipher_type == 'gpg': 
 355              if not sign and not encrypt: 
 356                  self.error="No sign and no encrypt is set but cipher type to gpg"

 359              # need a python-pyme package and gpgme lib 
 360              from pyme import core, constants, errors 
 361              import pyme.constants.validity

 363              ############################################

 366              if sign: 
 367                  import string 
 368                  core.check_version(None)

 370                  plain = core.Data(pin) 
 371                  sig = core.Data() 
 372                  c = core.Context() 
 373                  c.set_armor(1) 
 374                  c.signers_clear()

 382                  c.set_passphrase_cb(lambda x,y,z: sign_passphrase) 
 383                  try: 
 384                      # make a signature 
 385                      c.op_sign(plain,sig,mode.DETACH)

 405              #                  encrypt                 #

 408                  core.check_version(None)

 445          ####################################################### 
 446          #                       X.509                         # 
 447          ####################################################### 
 448          elif cipher_type == 'x509':

 464              from M2Crypto import BIO, SMIME, X509 
 465              msg_bio = BIO.MemoryBuffer(payload_in.as_string()) 
 466              s = SMIME.SMIME() 
 467               
 468              #                   SIGN 
 469              if sign:

 473                      if encrypt:

 475                      else:

 478                  except Exception,e: 
 479                      self.error="Something went wrong on signing: <%s>" %str(e) 
 480                      return False 
 481                       
 482              #                   ENCRYPT 
 483              if encrypt: 
 484                  try: 
 485                      sk = X509.X509_Stack() 
 486                      if not isinstance(x509_crypt_certfiles, (list, tuple)): 
 487                          x509_crypt_certfiles = [x509_crypt_certfiles] 
 488                       
 489                      # make an encryption cert's stack 
 490                      for x in x509_crypt_certfiles: 
 491                          sk.push(X509.load_cert(x)) 
 492                      s.set_x509_stack(sk) 
 493                       
 494                      s.set_cipher(SMIME.Cipher('des_ede3_cbc')) 
 495                      tmp_bio = BIO.MemoryBuffer() 
 496                      if sign: 
 497                          s.write(tmp_bio, p7) 
 498                      else: 
 499                          tmp_bio.write(payload_in.as_string()) 
 500                      p7 = s.encrypt(tmp_bio) 
 501                  except Exception,e: 
 502                      self.error="Something went wrong on encrypting: <%s>" %str(e) 
 503                      return False 
 504               
 505              #                 Final stage in sign and encryption 
 506              out = BIO.MemoryBuffer() 
 507              if encrypt: 
 508                  s.write(out, p7) 
 509              else: 
 510                  if sign: 
 511                      s.write(out, p7, msg_bio, SMIME.PKCS7_DETACHED) 
 512                  else: 
 513                      out.write('\r\n') 
 514                      out.write(payload_in.as_string()) 
 515              out.close() 
 516              st=str(out.read()) 
 517              payload=message_from_string(st) 
 518          else: 
 519              # no cryptography process as usual 
 520              payload=payload_in 
 521          payload['From'] = encode_header(self.settings.sender.decode(encoding)) 
 522          if to: 
 523              payload['To'] = encode_header(', '.join(to).decode(encoding)) 
 524          if reply_to: 
 525              payload['Reply-To'] = encode_header(reply_to.decode(encoding))

 536          try: 
 537              if self.settings.server == 'logging': 
 538                  logging.warn('email not sent\n%s\nFrom: %s\nTo: %s\n\n%s\n%s\n' % \ 
 539                                   ('-'*40,self.settings.sender,

 544                  if attachments:

 552                  server = smtplib.SMTP(*self.settings.server.split(':'))

 560                  server.quit() 
 561          except Exception, e: 
 562              logging.warn('Mail.send failure:%s' % e) 
 563              self.result = result 
 564              self.error = e

 671   
 672      Authentication Example:: 
 673   
 674          from contrib.utils import * 
 675          mail=Mail() 
 676          mail.settings.server='smtp.gmail.com:587' 
 677          mail.settings.sender='you@somewhere.com' 
 678          mail.settings.login='username:password' 
 679          auth=Auth(globals(), db) 
 680          auth.settings.mailer=mail 
 681          # auth.settings....=... 
 682          auth.define_tables() 
 683          def authentication(): 
 684              return dict(form=auth()) 
 685   
 686      exposes: 
 687   
 688      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/login 
 689      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/logout 
 690      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/register 
 691      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/verify_email 
 692      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/retrieve_username 
 693      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/retrieve_password 
 694      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/reset_password 
 695      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/profile 
 696      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/change_password 
 697   
 698      On registration a group with role=new_user.id is created 
 699      and user is given membership of this group. 
 700   
 701      You can create a group with:: 
 702   
 703          group_id=auth.add_group('Manager', 'can access the manage action') 
 704          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'access to manage') 
 705   
 706      Here \"access to manage\" is just a user defined string. 
 707      You can give access to a user:: 
 708   
 709          auth.add_membership(group_id, user_id) 
 710   
 711      If user id is omitted, the logged in user is assumed 
 712   
 713      Then you can decorate any action:: 
 714   
 715          @auth.requires_permission('access to manage') 
 716          def manage(): 
 717              return dict() 
 718   
 719      You can restrict a permission to a specific table:: 
 720   
 721          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'edit', db.sometable) 
 722          @auth.requires_permission('edit', db.sometable) 
 723   
 724      Or to a specific record:: 
 725   
 726          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'edit', db.sometable, 45) 
 727          @auth.requires_permission('edit', db.sometable, 45) 
 728   
 729      If authorization is not granted calls:: 
 730   
 731          auth.settings.on_failed_authorization 
 732   
 733      Other options:: 
 734   
 735          auth.settings.mailer=None 
 736          auth.settings.expiration=3600 # seconds 
 737   
 738          ... 
 739   
 740          ### these are messages that can be customized 
 741          ...

1719 -    def random_password(self): 

1720          import string

1722          password = ''
